marklogic.body:
Don't know if they'd do it -- but the seem to be treating Brandon Inge in the same manner as the Angels are Abreu (i.e. we like this guy, but he's not a fit for us, we have other options, and we'd like to move him in a respectful way even if what we get is minimal).
Abreu for Inge. For the Angels good due to Inge's versatility - the wild card being an unofficial extra catcher for extra-inning games where a pinch hitter could replace the C Spot in a critical at bat time.
Abreu is still a good OBP guy, can play some OF, and on the Tigers might DH more until Victor Martinez comes back.
Abreu's 9 million vs Inge's 5.5 million would probably mean the Angels eating some salary - or perhaps a deal could be expanded.
A big problem with a deal between these two teams would be that both are playoff caliber - hence even more dicey to deal with than non-p-caliber teams in one's own division. But being a "spare parts" deal, maybe this could get done.
